borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, by reason of its design, siting and incongruous roof form will disrupt the built form and uniformity within the terrace, street scene and the Becontree Estate. The proposed development would therefore represent unsympathetic and uncharacteristic additions to the site. The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies D1, D4, D8, HC1 of The London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP2, and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and SPP6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>

<p>The scale, siting and design of the proposed first floor rear extension would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers at No.242 Oval Road North, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policy 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</p><p>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020)</p>
description:
Construction of a first floor rear extension and
construction of a hip-to-gable roof extension including two roof lights to the
front.
